I am a senior at University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign. My major is Computer Science, and my current interests lie in data analytics. My vision is to bring about social good by acting upon information carved from data. Among several projects, I am currently focusing on interactive visual data exploration systems. A fun fact about me is that I am a third culture kid. Hover over circles in the map to learn how these places have shaped me.

About

Education

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

Illinois is where I began the persuit of knowledge for CS. I am grateful for the opportunity to build relationships with collegues and learn from mentors.


Research Labs


The Zenvisage Team develops data anlytics software. I provide frontend & backend support in addition to individual initiatives. Working amongst team of graduate students and professors, crystalize and apply my knowledge through academic research. This project is led by Professor. Aditya Parameswaran.







The Entity Search Team was a team of undergrads led by Professor. Kevin C.C. Chang. We developed information retrieval software related to Named Entity Recognition and Web Search.


Military Service

I served 2 years in the army as a KATUSA for the ROK-US alliance. I was dispatched to the Public Relations Office of United States Forces Korea to bridge gaps between the two forces. I take pride in my commitment to strengthen the alliance.
